alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Taylor (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 13 at 5:23AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Crawford and northeastern Taylor Counties through 545 AM EDT... At 523 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Carsonville, or 10 miles north of Butler, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Roberta, Knoxville, Lee Pope, Sandy Point, Horns, Musella and Fickling Mill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
